result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam L Tritz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and DNA to be paid at a amount of $25.00 monthly commencing 7/01/16; Alternate 13 days jail.

With Huber.
Release for work, treatment, and taking his girlfriend to her ultra sounds appointment and appointment to be verified.
AMENDED 07-07-2016:  Apply 1 day sentence credit.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: date 6/30/16 filed by defendant requesting sentence credit
dated today from Court to defendant denying request

dated 6/14/16 filed by defendant requesting sentence modification.

The Court has reviewed the request for a reduction in sentence and denies the request.

Defendant's sentence is stayed from June 6, 2016 to June 14, 2016.  Defendant is to return to Huber no later than 7:00 p.m. on June 14, 2016.  The furlough will extend defendant's release date by the days that he is gone.  Defendant is not to use or possess alcohol or illegal drugs during this furlough.
dated 6/6/16 filed by Froedtert Hospital on behalf of defendant requesting a sentence leave.

Defendant is granted an order for furlough from May 25, 2016 to 7:00 p.m. on May 29, 2016 to attend a medical appointment out of state with H.P.  The furlough will extend defendant's release date by the days that he is gone.  Defendant is not to use or possess alcohol or illegal drugs during this furlough.
Fax cover sheet dated 5/24/16 filed by Attorney Kershek with stip and order.
Motion and proposed Order for Furlough from Huber

undated letter filed by third-party requesting sentence modification

Denied by Judge Maxwell 5/9/16
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Adam L Tritz in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 1. Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

90 days jail with huber for work, treatment and taking his girlfriend to her ultra sounds appointment and appointment to be vertified. Sentence to commence 04/29/2015 by 6 pm. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
DNA Surcharge $200.00
Domestic Abuse Surcharge $100.00
Court Costs $243.00
Defendant to pay $25.00 a month commencing 07/01/2016 or alternate of 13 days jail.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Heather P. listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Not to enter the property Richy's Bar.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.  Can have one trip the residence escorted by a peace officer.

Defendant Adam L Tritz in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
